UI_visible_response: Yes, China's economy has been slowing down recently. In 2024, China experienced another year of economic slowdown, with the GDP growth rate declining to 4.8 percent year-on-year2. Furthermore, in the third quarter of 2024, the Chinese economy expanded by only 4.6% year-over-year, marking the slowest annual growth rate and aligning with market forecasts of 4.5%7. This trend indicates that China's economy is facing challenges and is projected to continue slowing in the foreseeable future1.
traffic_visible_response: Yes, China's economy has been slowing down recently. In 2024, China experienced another year of economic slowdown, with the GDP growth rate declining to 4.8 percent year-on-year [[2]]. Furthermore, in the third quarter of 2024, the Chinese economy expanded by only 4.6% year-over-year, marking the slowest annual growth rate and aligning with market forecasts of 4.5% [[7]]. This trend indicates that China's economy is facing challenges and is projected to continue slowing in the foreseeable future [[1]].
